intro: Erigeron acris var. ruber, commonly known as the red leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It is characterized by its distinctive red-tinged leaves and yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many common garden flowers. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological and horticultural study.
